name: Beanie Babies A-Z Quiz Series - P  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these is an injured puppy?
questions.explanation:
Pads.

	Pads is a cream-colored dog with dark brown paws and a single dark brown ear.  He wears a collar that says PDSA on it.  He has a broken front leg, covered in blue gauze. "For those in need who have a poorly pet PDSA can supply a vetBut our support is what they really needThis charity that is a friend indeed!"

questions.text: Which of these is a frog?
questions.explanation:
Panama.

	Panama is a red-eyed tree frog.  He is mostly green, but he has large red eyes, and his feet are orange.  His feet are much bigger than his face! "Want to know what's really neat?I have suction cups on my feetThey help me climb high up a treeTo see the jungle under me!"

questions.text: Which of these bears sits differently from the other choices?
questions.explanation:
Parka.

	Peace, Pappa, and Patriot all sit like a human does, and is the most common Beanie Baby shape.  Parka sits like Manes or Aurora, with their rear end on the ground and their paws out in front of them.  Parka is a grayish white polar bear. "Now I'm not here to brag or gloatBut I've got the warmest furry coatI wear it everywhere I goTo help keep out the cold and snow!"

questions.text: Which of these is a platypus?
questions.explanation:
Patti.

	Patti is a purple platypus.  There are four different colors of Patti, including a very light pinkish purple to a very dark plum purple. "Ran into Patti one day while walkingBelieve me she wouldn't stop talkingListened and listened to her speak That would explain her extra large beak!"

questions.text: Which of these is a walrus?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	Paul the walrus is all brown, except for his nose and tusks.  His nose is the same type of nose that can be found on Batty and Cheeks. "Traveling the ocean in a submarineSinging and playing a tambourineOne day hoping to lead a bandFirst he needs to find dry land!"

questions.text: Which of these is an elephant?
questions.explanation:
Peanut.

	Peanut was originally a light blue elephant.  However, one day, the machine that made Peanut went wrong, and the dye became dark, and Peanut became a royal blue elephant.  The problem was quickly corrected, but they decided to still sell royal blue Peanut, and it has become a very rare elephant.  Both poems are the same. "Peanut the elephant walks on tip-toesQuietly sneaking wherever she goesShe'll sneak up on you and a hug you will getPeanut is a friend you won't soon forget!"

questions.text: Which of these is a flat Beanie Baby bear?
questions.explanation:
Peking.

	Peking is a panda bear.  He sits differently than most bears, as he is a flat Beanie Baby, like Fleece or Doby.  He is very rare, and does not have a poem.

questions.text: What kind of creature is Pellet?
questions.explanation:
Hamster.

	Pellet sits with his front limbs up.  He is a yellow hamster, and does not have a tail. "I have many things to doBut it seems I'm never throughOn my wheel I spin all dayThis is how I love to play!"

questions.text: Which of these is a ghost bear?
questions.explanation:
Phantom.

	Phantom is an all white bear, but instead of legs that sit in front of him, he has a ghostly tail that sits next to him.  He has a black and orange scarf, and he holds a pumpkin. "With pumpkins there's lots you can do Make funny carvings: scary, too Then there are pumpkin seeds to eatBut pumpkin pie's my favorite treat!"

questions.text: Which of these is an all-red creature?
questions.explanation:
Pinchers.

	Pinchers is the only red creature in the list, as the other three are all pink.  Pinchers is a lobster, and is sometimes called Punchers. "This lobster loves to pinchEating his food inch by inchBalancing carefully with his tailMoving forward slow as a snail!"
